gr.interamerican.wicket.bo2.protocol.http
Class Bo2WicketRequestCycle

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.wicket.bo2.protocol.http.Bo2WicketRequestCycle

public class Bo2WicketRequestCycle
extends Object

Maintains the Bo2 context associated with a web Request-Response cycle. This includes logging and Workers opened in the cycle.
This class also serves as a facade for transparently performing operations on Workers on web layer code.
Each wicket request cycle creates a Bo2WicketRequestCycle object that is associated with the current thread. Its facilities are available through public static methods that mutate the thread local instance.
The naming is such for legacy reasons. TODO: rename to Bo2WicketRequestCycleContext

beginRequest

public static void beginRequest(org.apache.wicket.request.cycle.RequestCycle cycle)
Calls onBeginRequest() on the specified cycle. Exposes the protected method. Should be used only by test classes in order to emulate the wicket request-response cycle.

Parameters:
cycle - RequestCycle on which the method is invoked.

reattach

public static final void reattach(Object object)
This method will reattach a dettached object to the current hibernate session. The method is a facade that hides the hibernate session. If the current deployment does not support hibernate, the method will do nothing. If the specified object was not managed by hibernate, then nothing will happen. Only if the specified object was managed by hibernate, will it be attached to the session. This behavior guarantees that the application will run even if the specified object's persistence worker, changes and is not longer based on hibernate.

Parameters:
object - The object to re-attach

reattachForUpdate

public static final void reattachForUpdate(Object object)
This method will reattach a dettached object to the current hibernate session. In the unit of work that this is called, it is mandatory to perform a database update.

Parameters:
object - The object to re-attach

provider

public static final Provider provider()
Gets the provider of the Bo2WicketRequestCycle associated with the current thread.

Returns:
Returns the provider.

markExplicitSave

public void markExplicitSave(Object object)
Marks the specified object as being saved only when explicitly defined by its persistent worker. This method is used in order to prevent unintentionally saving changes to the specified. This could happen if the underlying persistence worker of the specified object is based on hibernate. Hibernate will flush all changes to any managed object whenever flush is called. This method will result in the specified object being excluded from flush. Calling this method will also change the flushing policy of the current cycle's HibernateSessionProvider to FlushStrategy#EXCLUDING.
If the current deployment does not support hibernate or the specified object is not managed by hibernate, then this method will have no effect.

Parameters:
object - Object to mark.

getProvider

public Provider getProvider()
Gets the provider.

Returns:
Returns the provider
